result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Desmon L Keys in court.  Attorney Zaki Zehawi in court for Desmon L Keys.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Sarah Thomford from DCPS appeared in court. In court today for a bail/bond hearing after violations on DCPS. State gives argument and requests an increase in cash bail. Defense gives argument. Court makes findings and will not make any further changes to bail/bond conditions. Any further violations will result in cash bail being raised. Trial dates will be set for all cases.

Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DE does not have attorney reappointed by SPD. DE taken into custody on DCPS warrant in 22CM483

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
Cash bail increased to $500 ($300 previously posted). If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Bail increased by $200

9:01 AM  Defendant appeared. Attorney William Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests counsel from bench; so granted.  Court counsels DE from the bench; conditions of bail are continued.

Status conference on March 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $300 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
